responses.rationale: Reports numerical data ('at least 320 bird and 25 mammal species') using a standard verb ('infected').
Reports numerical data ('More than 500,000 birds') using a standard verb ('have died').
Reports a numerical metric ('96% Proportion') using standard descriptive language.
Reports a numerical metric ('more than 500,000 chickens') using a standard verb ('euthanised').
Reports numerical data ('on four farms', 'at a fifth farm') using a standard verb ('has been detected').
Reports a numerical limit ('A 24-egg limit') using a standard verb ('applies').
Reports a numerical limit ('A 24-egg limit') using a standard verb ('applies').
Reports locations and timing ('at a large egg farm', 'at another egg farm') using a standard verb ('detected').
Reports numerical data ('at three other properties') using a standard verb ('were identified').
Reports a case count ('second known instance') using standard verbs ('tested positive', 'is').
Reports a previous case ('previous human case') using a standard verb ('was reported').
Reports on species infected ('Infections have also been reported in animals') using a standard verb ('reported').
Reports numerical metrics ('some 890 human cases', 'fatality rate of roughly 50%') using a standard verb ('reported').
Reports findings ('tested positive') and locations/counts ('at two dairy farms', 'one in Texas') using standard verbs ('reported', 'tested positive').
Reports a finding ('virus was found') and location ('in a Michigan dairy herd') using a standard verb ('found').
Reports a finding ('virus was found', 'has been detected') and its significance ('first time') using standard verbs ('found', 'detected').
Reports numerical metric ('tens of millions of chickens, turkeys and other birds') using a standard verb ('has led to the death').
Reports numerical metric ('Thousands of chickens and other poultry birds') using a standard verb ('have been culled').
Reports prices reaching 'record highs' using a standard verb ('sent'). 'Red-hot inflation' is background context.
Reports numerical metric ('across 46 states') using a standard verb ('infected').
Reports numerical metrics ('30 percent', '85 percent') using a standard verb ('were traced').
Reports numerical metric ('more than 70 percent') using a standard verb ('account for').
Reports a confirmation ('first confirmation') and its timing ('since 2020') using a standard verb ('has said').
Reports numerical metrics ('11 poultry farms', 'loss of more than 400,000 birds') using standard verbs ('affected', 'resulting in the loss').
Reports numerical metric ('Seven people') and outcome ('developed symptoms') using standard verbs ('developed', 'reported').
Reports numerical metric ('one household member and six health care workers') and outcome ('developed symptoms') using a standard verb ('developed').
Reports numerical metric ('13 other confirmed cases') using a standard verb ('have been').
Reports numerical metrics ('no H5N1-related deaths', 'mortality rate of up to 50 percent') and describes severity ('relatively mild') using standard verbs ('reported', 'have been').
Reports numerical metric ('small number of confirmed cases') and its implication using a standard verb ('makes').
Reports a numerical proportion ('only a tiny fraction') in a hypothetical scenario using standard language.
Reports a disclosure ('C.D.C. disclosed') and outcome ('had developed gastrointestinal symptoms') using standard verbs ('disclosed', 'developed').
Reports numerical metric ('added four more health care workers') using a standard verb ('added').
Reports numerical metric ('Three of the workers') and outcome ('developed symptoms', 'were not tested') using standard verbs ('developed', 'were not tested').
Reports lack of identification ('No one... has been identified') using a standard verb ('has been identified').
Reports numerical metrics ('187 detections', '3,573 HPAI events') using standard verbs ('notified', 'recorded').
Reports a case ('A person... has tested positive') using standard verbs ('tested positive', 'confirmed'). 'highly pathogenic' is technical.
Reports on species infected ('has also infected mammalian species') using a standard verb ('infected').
Reports numerical metric ('in five U.S. states') and location of findings ('infections have been found') using a standard verb ('found').
Reports numerical metric ('second known to occur') using a standard verb ('is').
Reports numerical metrics ('second known to occur', 'first was in 2022') and details using standard verbs ('is', 'was', 'tested positive').
Reports details of a case ('tested positive') and outcome ('reported mild fatigue', 'later recovered') using standard verbs ('was', 'tested positive', 'reported', 'recovered').
Reports numerical metric ('hundreds of dead birds') using a standard verb ('record').
Reports on costs ('higher poultry costs') using a standard verb ('passing on').
Reports numerical metric ('cutting the NIAID budget by 23.9%') using a standard verb ('cutting').
Reports location and count ('at two egg-producing farms') of discovery ('was discovered') using a standard verb ('discovered').
Reports numerical metric ('138 million head') using a standard verb ('amounting to').
Reports numerical metric ('country's second case') and location using standard verbs ('was', 'was affected').
Reports a market requirement change ('eggs must now be marketed as "barn eggs"') based on a time period ('16-week grace period... has now been exceeded') using standard verbs.
Reports locations ('A poultry facility in Michigan and egg producer in Texas') of outbreaks using a standard verb ('reported').
Reports developments ('infected dairy cows', 'first known instance of a human catching bird flu') using standard verbs ('include', 'catching').
Reports on spread among species and locations ('in scores of countries') using a standard verb ('spreading'). 'scores of' is a general quantifier.
Reports numerical metrics ('nearly 900 people have been diagnosed', 'more than 460 people have died') using standard verbs ('have been diagnosed', 'have died').
Reports potential outcomes ('see higher prices', 'experience "reputational strain"') using standard verbs ('see', 'experience', 'affecting'). 'Higher prices' is factual.
Reports market condition ('tightening of supply') and numerical metric ('consume an average of 3 billion eggs') using standard verbs ('is experiencing', 'consume').
Reports trade volume ('imports a small amount of beef') using a standard verb ('imports').
Reports on a case ('tested positive') and symptoms ('suffered conjunctivitis') using standard verbs ('tested positive', 'suffered').
Reports numerical metric ('more than 500 dead seabirds') using a standard verb ('saw').
Reports on funding levels ('have limited conservation funds') using a standard verb ('have').
Reports numerical metrics ('found 246 dead birds', 'found 107') using a standard verb ('found').
Reports historical numerical metric ('killed an estimated 50 million people') using a standard verb ('killed').
Reports outcome ('were found dead') using a standard verb ('found').
Reports location ('in the southern and central coast') of strandings using a standard verb ('have happened').
Reports numerical trend ('continued to increase') using a standard verb ('increase').
Reports numerical trend ('continued to increase') using a standard verb ('increase'). 'really busy' describes the season, not the strandings themselves.
Reports numerical metric ('More than a dozen') and describes severity ('relatively mild symptoms') using standard verbs ('have been infected', 'experiencing').
Reports numerical metric ('laid off close to 400 employees') using a standard verb ('laid off').
Reports impact on prices ('is impacting food prices') using a standard verb ('impacting'). 'mass culling' describes the cause, not the price impact.
Reports impact on prices ('impacts food prices') using a standard verb ('impacts'). 'mass culling of so many chickens' describes the cause, not the price impact.
Reports impact on prices ('impacts food prices') and numerical metric ('9% of laying hens... have been culled') using standard verbs ('impacts', 'have been culled').
Reports numerical metrics ('Prices... are 350 Japanese yen, or $2.67', 'going up 70%') using standard verbs ('are', 'going up').
Reports on business actions ('have suspended certain food items') using a standard verb ('have suspended').
Reports numerical metric ('About 20% of 100 listed companies') and action ('have suspended egg-related items') using a standard verb ('have suspended').
Reports on impact ('affecting the poultry industry and in turn egg prices') using a standard verb ('affecting').
Reports detection ('has detected') and location ('on a poultry farm') using a standard verb ('detected'). 'highly pathogenic' is technical.
Reports on spread ('is spreading quickly') using a standard verb ('spreading') and neutral adverb ('quickly').
Reports potential consequence ('impose trade restrictions') using a standard verb ('impose').
Reports numerical metric ('remained at $2.07 per dozen') using a standard verb ('remained').
Reports numerical metric ('at $1.62') and trend ('has climbed pretty steadily') using a standard verb ('climbed') and neutral adverb ('pretty steadily').
Reports numerical metrics ('averaged $1.15 per pound', 'down from last year's $1.79', 'previous year's $1.35') using standard verbs ('averaged', 'down from').
Reports numerical metric ('has cost the government $757 million') using a standard verb ('has cost').
